There's positive freedom and negative freedom, i.e., freedom to live your life without being discriminated against or without being targeted by violence (in this context, this could be hate speech). Neither of these cannot be fully enforced without limiting the other one. And I disagree that people know morals and share the same acceptable behaviour - this can wildly differ between different social groups (there are a lot of people who think that FGM is acceptable). So you can have social media with very little or even without any regulation, but it will almost certainly violate the negative freedom of some, perhaps more vulnerable members of the society.
